summary: Request to distribute pre-built binaries for native Rust code used in the TypeScript SDK worker and workflow-isolate-extension to simplify installation and avoid requiring node-gyp compilation.
userImpact: Users currently need to compile native dependencies during SDK installation, which requires build tools like node-gyp to be installed.
proposedFix: Distribute pre-built binaries for native worker code and workflow-isolate-extension similar to approaches used in Neon bindings
workaround: Install node-gyp system dependency for compilation during installation
resolutionDetails: Issue deprioritized after implementing precompilation of Rust code (#58). Determined that node-gyp is a common and simple enough dependency for SDK installation.
keyQuote: Won't do, only system dependency to install the SDK is node-gyp which is quite common and simple to install.
